content: कूट {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} False; as in कूटाः स्युः पूर्वसाक्षिणः <ls>Y. 2. 80.</ls> {@--2@} Immoveable, steady. {@--3@} Despised. --टः, --टं {@--1@} Fraud, illusion, deception. {@--2@} A trick, fraudulent or roguish scheme. {@--3@} A puzzling question, knotty or intricate point, as in कूटश्लोक, कूटान्योक्ति. {@--4@} Falsehood, untruth; <ab>oft.</ab> used in <ab>comp.</ab> with the force of an adjective; °वचनं false or deceitful words; °तुला, °मानं &c. {@--5@} A summit or peak of a mountain; वर्धयन्निव तत्कूटानुद्धतैर्धातुरेणुभिः <ls>R. 4. 71</ls>, <ls>Me. 113</ls>; <ls>Māl. 5. 32.</ls> {@--6@} Any projection or prominence. {@--7@} The bone of the forehead with its projections, the crown of the head. {@--8@} A horn. {@--9@} End, corner; <ls>Y. 3. 96.</ls> {@--10@} Head, chief. {@--11@} A heap, mass, multitude; अभ्रकूटं ‘a heap of clouds’; so अन्नकूटं ‘a heap of food’; <ls>Mv. 6. 32.</ls> {@--12@} A hammer, an iron mallet. {@--13@} A plough-share, the body of a plough. {@--14@} A trap for catching deer. {@--15@} A concealed weapon, as a dagger in a woollen case or a sword in a stick. {@--16@} A water-jar. {@--17@} The door of a city. --टः {@--1@} A house, dwelling. {@--2@} An ox whose horns are broken. {@--3@} An epithet of Agastya.
